result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case called @ 3:42 p.m. Defendant Bryan Richard Tynon not in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Based on non appearance the Court authorizes the issuance of a bench warrant extraditable within the State of Wisconsin. The Court orders the $150 Cash Bond forfeited. The Court tolls the time on the Deferred Sentencing Agreement.
from Atty Zamow - no longer represents the DE on this matter

State's Motion to Vacate Deferred Sentencing Agreement
by USPS - Moved left no address- Unable to Forward
Sentencing hearing on March 3, 2017 at 01:45 pm.
from the DE's employer to the Court
12 month Deferred Sentencing Agreement

Case called @ 3:46 p.m. Defendant Bryan Richard Tynon in court with attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement recited by DA Blader to the extent that there is an agreement. Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant. Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained.  Consequences explained for failure to abide by terms of Deferred Sentencing Agreement. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. The parties ask the Court to defer sentencing and establish terms of the Deferred Sentencing Agreement - there are disputed components of the agreement - AODA Assessment and the Anger Managment Program as well as the length of the agreement. Argument by DA Blader. Argument by Atty Szilagyi. Statement by DE. Court imposes a 12 month Deferred Sentencing Agreement with the following terms/conditions - The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, AODA but no follow through required, N/C/C w/ D. Stearns, S. Witzczak. Matter stayed for 12 months. The Court reminds the defendant that bond remains in effect throughout the pendency of the Deferred Sentencing Agreement.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 02-29-2016 03:45 pm

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case Called @ 2:01 PM: Defendant Bryan Richard Tynon in court, appearing via telephone with Court's permission today.    Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court undertakes waiver of personal appearance today.  Court accepts waiver of personal appearance.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def states he wishes counsel - is in the process of trying to retain own counsel.  Court will proceed with that understanding that his own counsel will be retained.  ADA argues for $150 cash bond w/conditions.    No statement as to bond by Def.  NGP entered by Court    STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Def to speak with his counsel and have a NOR filed forthwith.  Status conference scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
from Defendant Re: Request for Rescheduling 7/28/2015 IA
